Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can illustrate at least three different living things in each habitat, such as plants and animals.
The student can show different kinds of plants like trees, grasses, or flowering plants in the land habitat.
The student can include various animals, such as lizards or squirrels, in the land habitat.
The student can depict different types of aquatic plants or animals, like fish or clams, in the water habitat.
The student can use their drawings to compare the different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can identify patterns in their drawings, such as which types of living things are common to both habitats and which are unique.
